unique_aer_id_number.description: The globally unique adverse event report is designated by the Marketing Authorization Holder. It consists of a 3-character ISO 3166 country code, 8-character MAH identifier code, and a unique number assigned by the MAH. If the report originally was sent by a Regulatory Authority, this number may include the RA identifier code in place of the MAH identifier code.

report_id.description: The globally unique adverse event report is designated by the Marketing Authorization Holder. It consists of a 3-character ISO 3166 country code, 8-character MAH identifier code, and a unique number assigned by the MAH. If the report originally was sent by a Regulatory Authority, this number may include the RA identifier code in place of the MAH identifier code.

original_receive_date.description: The date of the first receipt of information by the MAH responsible for reporting the adverse event to the FDA.

primary_reporter.description: The person or organization who holds or provides the most pertinent information related to the adverse event report.

secondary_reporter.description: A person or organization who also possesses pertinent information related to the adverse event report e.g. if the primary reporter is a veterinarian, the secondary reporter may be the animal owner.

type_of_information.description: A list of values regarding the type of information in the report.

serious_ae.description: A list of values (Yes or No) characterizing the seriousness of the adverse event.

value.Yes: The adverse event is fatal or life-threatening, or requires professional intervention, or causes an abortion, or stillbirth, or infertility, or congenital anomaly, or prolonged or permanent disability, or disfigurement.

value.No: The adverse event is none of the above.

number_of_animals_treated.description: Number of animals being treated directly but the veterinary medicinal product.

number_of_animals_affected.description: Total number of animals affected by the adverse event, whether through direct or indirect exposure (e.g. treated during pregnancy or lactation, commingled, infection spread, etc.).

species.description: A list of values regarding the species of animal affected.

gender.description: Described whether the affected animal(s) is male or female.

reproductive_status.description: Describes whether the affected animal(s) is intact or neutered.

female_animal_physiological_status.description: Describes the pregnancy and lactation status of affected female animal(s).

age.description: Describes the age of the affected animal(s).

weight.description: Describes the weight of the animals involved in the adverse event.

breed.description: Describes the breed of the animal(s) associated with the species.

number_of_animals_affected.description: Total number of animals affected by the adverse event, whether through direct or indirect exposure (e.g. treated during pregnancy or lactation, commingled, infection spread, etc.).

health_assessment_prior_to_exposure.description: Veterinarianâ€™s assessment of the health status of the animal(s) involved in the adverse event prior to exposure. In case of human exposure, this would be the assessment by the attending physician.

assessed_by.description: Who the animal affected by the adverse event was assessed by.

onset_date.description: The date (day, month or year) of the onset of the adverse event.

duration.description: The numeric value for the duration of the adverse event.

veddra_term_name.description: The VeDDRA Vocabulary is the VICH-harmonized list for submission of AE terms. The most current list, as well as a full explanation and guidance notes on the use of VeDDRA Terminology for Reporting Adverse Events in Animals, can be downloaded here.

number_of_animals_affected.description: Total number of animals affected by the adverse event, whether through direct or indirect exposure (e.g. treated during pregnancy or lactation, commingled, infection spread, etc.).

time_between_exposure_and_onset.description: The length of time between the first exposure to the veterinary medicinal product and the onset of the adverse event.

treated_for_ae.description: A list of values (Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable) describing whether or not the human or animal affected received treatment in response to the adverse event.

value.No: Human or animal was not treated.

value.Not Applicable: The veterinary medicinal product was neither stopped nor re-introduced.

first_exposure_date.description: The date (day, month and year) on which the animal was first treated with the veterinary medicinal product.

last_exposure_date.description: The date (day, month and year) on which the animal was last treated with the veterinary medicinal product.

frequency_of_administration.description: Frequency of administration of the veterinary medicinal product(s) involved in the adverse event.

administered_by.description: Describes the individual who administered the veterinary medicinal product(s) to the animal(s) involved in the adverse event.

route.description: Route by which the veterinary medicinal product was administered.

dose.description: The actual dose administered to the animal involved in the adverse event.

used_according_to_label.description: A list of values (Yes, No, or Unknown) describing whether the veterinary medicinal product was used according to its labeled recommendations/directions of use.

value.Yes: The veterinary medicinal product was used according to its labeled recommendations/directions of use.

value.No: The veterinary medicinal product was used in an off-label use manner.

off_label_use.description: Describes how the veterinary medicinal product was used in an off-label manner.

previous_exposure_to_drug.description: A list of values (Yes, No, or Unknown) describing whether or not the affected animal(s) had been exposed to the veterinary medicinal product on a date previous to the adverse event report.

previous_ae_to_drug.description: No = The adverse event is none of the above.

value.Yes: There was a previous adverse event.

value.No: There was no previous adverse event.

value.Not Applicable: There was no previous exposure to the veterinary medicinal product.

ae_abated_after_stopping_drug.description: A list of values (Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable) describing whether the adverse event abated after stopping the veterinary medicinal product.

value.Not Applicable: The veterinary medicinal product was neither stopped nor re-introduced.

ae_reappeared_after_resuming_drug.description: A list of values (Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable) describing whether the adverse event reappeared after re-introduction of the veterinary medicinal product.

value.Not Applicable: The veterinary medicinal product was neither stopped nor re-introduced.

manufacturing_date.description: The date the veterinary medicinal product was manufactured.

lot_number.description: The lot number of the veterinary medicinal product(s) involved in the adverse event.

lot_expiration.description: The expiration date of the veterinary medicinal product(s) involved in the adverse event.

product_ndc.description: The national drug code number for the veterinary medicinal product(s) involved in the adverse event

brand_name.description: The name by which the product is presented by the marketing authorization holder

dosage_form.description: The labeled dosage form of the veterinary medicinal product(s) involved in the adverse event.

brand_name.description: The name by which the product is presented by the marketing authorization holder.

dosage_form.description: The labeled dosage form of the veterinary medicinal product(s) involved in the adverse event.

generic_name.description: The generic name(s) of the veterinary medicinal product.

manufacturer_name.description: Manufacturer of the veterinary medicinal product involved in the adverse event.

nui.description: Unique Identifier Code of the veterinary medicinal product involved in the adverse event.

package_ndc.description: National Drug Code for the package containing veterinary medicinal products involved in an adverse event.

pharm_class_cs.description: Chemical structure classification of the veterinary medicinal productâ€™s pharmacologic class.

pharm_class_epc.description: Established pharmacologic class associated with an approved indication of an active moiety that the FDA has determined to be scientifically valid and clinically meaningful.

pharm_class_moa.description: Mechanism of action of the veterinary medicinal productâ€”molecular, subcellular, or cellular functional activityâ€”of the drugâ€™s established pharmacologic class.

pharm_class_pe.description: Physiologic effect or pharmacodynamics effectâ€”tissue, organ, or organ system functional activityâ€”of the drugâ€™s established pharmacologic class.

product_ndc.description: National Drug Code for the veterinary medicinal product(s) involved in an adverse event.

product_type.description: Type of veterinary medicinal product involved in the adverse event.

route.description: Route by which the veterinary medicinal product was administered.

rxcui.description: A unique number that described a semantic concept about the veterinary medicinal product, including its ingredients, strength, and dose forms.

spl_id.description: Unique identifier for a particular version of a Structured Product Label for a product

spl_set_id.description: Unique identifier for the Structured Product Label for a product, which is stable across versions of the label.

registration_number.description: A combination of the 3-character ISO 3166 code for the country where the veterinary medicinal product is approved, the 8-character RA Identifier code, and the registration number of the veterinary medicinal product involved in the adverse event.

number_of_defective_items.description: The number of defective items of the veterinary medicinal product described in the adverse event, based on the applicable retail unit.

number_of_items_returned.description: The number of veterinary medicinal products returned as described in the adverse event.

atc_vet_code.description: The Anatomic Therapeutic Chemical system for the classification of substance intended for therapeutic use, which can serve as a tool for the classification of Veterinary Medicinal Products.

active_ingredients.description: Active ingredients for the veterinary medicinal product.

dose.description: The actual dose administered to the animal involved in the adverse event.
